text: Aston Donald McEachin (October 10, 1961 – November 28, 2022) was an American politician and lawyer. He was the U.S. Representative from Virginia's 4th congressional district from 2017 to 2022. McEachin was a Democrat. He was in the Virginia House of Delegates (1996–2002; 2006–2008). McEachin ran for Congress for the open seat of Virginia's 4th congressional district vacated by Republican Randy Forbes in 2016 and won the general election with 57.3% of the votes. In 2001, he was the Democratic Party's nominee for Attorney General of Virginia, but he lost the election to Jerry Kilgore. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Lawyers from Virginia Category:United States representatives from Virginia Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:African-American politicians Category:Elected officials who died without taking their seats
title: Donald McEachin
